/ˌriːˈdʒɔɪn/ to return to someone or something: She rejoined her husband in Toronto, after her holiday in Paris.

rejoin verb
(ANSWER QUICKLY)
[ + speech ] formal uk
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/rɪˈdʒɔɪn/ us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/rɪˈdʒɔɪn/ to give a quick answer to what someone has said, in an angry or humorous way: "No, I do not have time to help you," he rejoined impatiently.
